BUSINESS.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART I - BUSINESS section of the GOOGL company report, formatted as bullet points:

• Google was founded in 1998 by Larry and Sergey.
• In 2016, Google became an AI-first company.
• Alphabet is a collection of businesses, with Google being the largest.
• Google reports its business in two segments: Google Services and Google Cloud, and all non-Google businesses as Other Bets.
• The Internet is one of the world's most powerful equalizers, propelling ideas, people, and businesses large and small.
• Trillions of searches occur on Google every year.
• YouTube provides entertainment, information, and opportunities to learn something new for its users.
• Google Cloud has invested over $150 billion in research and development in the last five years.
• Gemini is a natively multimodal AI model introduced by Google in 2023.
• Gemini 2.0 was launched in 2024, being the most capable model yet.
• All seven of Google's two billion-user products use Gemini for AI features.
• Google Cloud products include AI-optimized infrastructure and assistive agents and applications.

RISK FACTORS.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART I - RISK FACTORS section of GOOGL's report, formatted as bullet points:

• In 2024, more than 75% of total revenues came from online advertising.

• Many advertisers can terminate their contracts with GOOGL at any time if they do not create more value than their available alternatives.

• Changes to advertising policies and data privacy practices, such as the proposed user choice model for third-party cookies, may affect the company's ability to provide advertising services.

• Technologies have been developed that make personalized ads more difficult or block ad displays altogether.

• Advertiser expenditures tend to correlate with overall economic conditions, which can result in fluctuations in spending on advertising.

• GOOGL faces intense competition from other companies and emerging start-ups in different industries.

ITEM 1C. CYBERSECURITY.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 1C. CYBERSECURITY section in bullet points:

• GOOGL maintains a comprehensive process for identifying, assessing, and managing material risks from cybersecurity threats as part of its broader risk management system and processes.
• The company obtains input on its cybersecurity risk management program from multiple external experts and internal threat intelligence teams.
• Dedicated privacy, safety, and security professionals oversee cybersecurity risk management and mitigation, incident prevention, detection, and remediation.
• The Vice President of Privacy, Safety, and Security Engineering has 20 years of experience in technology infrastructure for two other large public companies.
• Incident management teams track and log privacy and security incidents across Alphabet, vendors, and third-party service providers to remediate and resolve any such incidents.
• Significant incidents are reviewed regularly by a cross-functional working group to determine whether further escalation is appropriate.
• The Audit and Compliance Committee has oversight responsibility for risks and incidents relating to cybersecurity threats, including compliance with disclosure requirements.

PROPERTIES.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART I - PROPERTIES section:

• Our headquarters are located in Mountain View, California.
• We own and lease office facilities and data centers around the world, primarily in Asia, Europe, and North America.

MARKET FOR REGISTRANT’S COMMON EQUITY, R.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the section:

* As of October 2, 2015, Alphabet Inc. became the successor issuer of Google Inc. pursuant to Rule 12g-3(a) under the Exchange Act.
* Our Class A stock has been listed on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol “GOOG” since August 19, 2004, and under the symbol "GOOGL" since April 3, 2014.
* As of December 31, 2024, there were approximately:
	+ 7,743 stockholders of record of our Class A stock
	+ 1,671 stockholders of record of our Class C stock
	+ 57 stockholders of record of our Class B stock
* Dividend payments to stockholders for the year ended December 31, 2024 were:
	+ $3.5 billion for Class A shares
	+ $519 million for Class B shares
	+ $3.3 billion for Class C shares
* The company intends to pay quarterly cash dividends in the future, subject to review and approval by the company's Board of Directors.
* Alphabet Inc.'s repurchase program does not have an expiration date and is executed from time to time through open market purchases or privately negotiated transactions.
* As of December 31, 2024, a $100 investment in our Class A common stock would have returned approximately:
	+ 45.6% compared to the S&P 500 Index
	+ 43.1% compared to the NASDAQ Composite Index
	+ 41.9% compared to the RDG Internet Composite index

MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART II - MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS section:

• Alphabet's largest business is Google, which is reported in two segments: Google Services and Google Cloud.
• The company expects users' behaviors and advertising to continue shifting online due to the evolution of the digital economy.
• Users are accessing Alphabet's products and services through diverse devices and modalities, affecting advertising revenues but also enabling new formats.
• Advertising revenues generated from mobile channels and newer formats have generally lower margins than traditional desktop search.
• The TAC (total access cost) paid to distribution partners is expected to increase as revenues grow, affecting the TAC rate as a percentage of advertising revenues.
• Changes in device mix, geographic mix, partner agreement terms, and revenue share terms can affect the TAC rate.
• Alphabet expects these trends to continue affecting revenues and putting pressure on margins.

QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART II - QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK section of GOOGL's financial report:

• The company estimates that an adverse 10% change in foreign currency exchange rates could result in an adverse effect on income before income taxes of approximately $503 million as of December 31, 2023.

• As of December 31, 2023 and 2024, the estimated impact of a 10% weakening of the U.S. dollar would be approximately $1.5 billion lower in accumulated other comprehensive income (AOCI) related to cash flow hedges before tax effect.

• The change in value recorded in AOCI would be expected to offset a corresponding foreign currency change in forecasted hedged revenues when recognized.

• If the U.S. dollar weakened by 10%, the amount recorded in cumulative translation adjustment (CTA) within AOCI related to net investment hedges before tax effect would have been approximately $946 million and $660 million lower as of December 31, 2023 and 2024, respectively.

FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY D.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA section, formatted as bullet points:

• Alphabet Inc.'s consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Company at December 31, 2023 and 2024, and the results of its operations and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024.

• The audit was conducted by an independent registered public accounting firm (PCAOB) and expressed an unqualified opinion on the Company's internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024.

• The PCAOB standards required a reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement due to error or fraud.

• The audit included evaluating the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statements.

CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES section, formatted as bullet points:

• As of December 31, 2024, GOOGL's disclosure controls and procedures are designed at a reasonable assurance level.
• The company's chief executive officer and chief financial officer concluded that the disclosure controls and procedures are effective to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be disclosed is recorded, processed, and reported in a timely manner.
• There have been no changes in GOOGL's internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December 31, 2024, that have materially affected or are reasonably likely to affect its internal control over financial reporting.
• GOOGL's management conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of its internal control over financial reporting based on the 2013 framework from the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.
• The effectiveness of GOOGL's internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024, has been audited by Ernst & Young LLP.

OTHER INFORMATION.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART II - OTHER INFORMATION section:

• John Hennessy adopted a trading plan on November 5, 2024, with the first trade under the plan scheduled for March 13, 2025.
• Sundar Pichai adopted a trading plan on December 2, 2024, with the first trade under the plan scheduled for April 2, 2025.
• The trading plans will be effective until March 13, 2026 (for John Hennessy) and April 18, 2026 (for Sundar Pichai).
• The total number of shares to be sold under both plans is 6,000 (Class C Capital Stock) and 1,200 (Class A Common Stock), totaling 7,200 shares.
• Sundar Pichai's trading plan will sell an aggregate of 876,000 shares of Class C Capital Stock.
• There were no "non-Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangements" adopted, modified, or terminated during the quarter ended December 31, 2024.

DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, AND CORPO.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART III - DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE section in bullet points:

• The information required by this item will be included under the caption “Directors, Executive Officers, and Corporate Governance” in the company's 2025 Proxy Statement, which is to be filed with the SEC within 120 days of the fiscal year ended December 31, 2024.

• The company has adopted insider trading policies and procedures governing the purchase, sale, and other dispositions of securities of Alphabet by directors, officers, and employees.

FORM 10-K SUMMARY.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART IV - FORM 10-K SUMMARY section:

• The Annual Report on Form 10-K was signed on February 4, 2025.
• Sundar Pichai and Anat Ashkenazi have been appointed as attorneys-in-fact to sign any amendments to this report.
